abstract: This viewgraph presentation provides an overview of a simulation exercise designed to determine the estimated time required to configure a commercial aircraft cabin for safe transit of atmospheric turbulence. Simulations are to be carried out in a number of wide-body and narrow-body aircraft cabins using professional cabin crews and paid passenger subjects. A number of variables are considered including passenger load, flight attendant compliment, cabin class and cabin activities. Various scenarios are also being played out in the exercises.
title: Secure Cabin Exercise Briefing

publications.publicationName: Proceedings of the Second NASA Aviation Safety Program Weather Accident Prevention Review

related.title: Proceedings of the Second NASA Aviation Safety Program Weather Accident Prevention Review
